manual.description:
Change working directory.
It takes 1 argument corresponding the name of the folder you want to move to. To get the possibles folder names, type 'cd ?'

Clear the terminal.
It does not take any argument.

Visualize full content of a specific email.
It takes 1 argument corresponding the uid of the mail to visualize. To get a list of emails with theirs uids, use command 'show'

Show a list of emails.
It has two optional arguments:
 - A number that indicates the length of email list
 - And keyword 'top' or 'bottom' for showing from newest or oldest emails
Default values are 50 for the length and top for the order, the optional parameters can be in any order!

Open the folder containing all attachments.
It does not take any argument.

Quit from the IMAP client program.
It does not take any argument.

Delete a specific mail.
It take 1 or more argument corresponding to the mails uids.

Let you visualize statistical information regarding the mailbox by graphical tools.
It does take arguments:
- spam: for visualizing percentage of spam emails
- plot days/months/years: for visualizing the number of emails received in span of times.

Let you search with string criteria.
 It takes multiple arguments separated with a space character. Each argument is formatted in the following way: 'field:value'
for example 'from:Google subject:account'.
 The fields are 'from','subject' and 'body' depending on where to search.
It's case insensitive but does not search for partial results, i.e. the word has to be complete

Logout from the current mailbox.
It does not take any argument

Permits notifications of only certain mailboxes or mail objects.
It takes two arguments, the first is 'mailbox' or 'subject' depending on the category to permit.
The second is the mailbox or subject to permit itself. Once an element is permitted, all denied ones are removed.
You can just type 'permit all' to set both denying mask at null

Permits notifications of only certain mailboxes or mail objects.
It takes two arguments, the first is 'mailbox' or 'subject' depending on the category to deny.
The second is the mailbox or subject to deny itself. Once an element is denied, all permitted ones are removed.
You can just type 'deny all' to set both denying mask at null

List of the permitted mailboxes or mail objects.
It does not take any argument.

List of the denied mailboxes or mail objects.
It does not take any argument.
